BURTON PAULU
KUOM, University of
Minnesota
Minneapolis, Minnesota
Dear Graydon:
Thank you for your April 7 letter* I am very
much interested in the prospect which is offered you via
the State Department for a three months assignment in
Germany* I think this ought to be most useful and
worthwhile, and I hope that you succeed in getting it*
I am certainly happy to recommend you.
When we have a chance to talk things over at
Columbus, you will see why you have heard very little
from me this year. This has been the most incredible
madhouse you can imagine getting a television operation
on the air and at the same time running our PM and AM.
Almost all of the headaches which people predict for
television operation come true, plus a few that they
failed to note. However, it is a very challenging
proposition and a lot of fun. There has been considerable
illness in our family for the past eight months and that
too has complicated matters at this end. I hope the last
half of the year will find me more communicative than
heretofore.
It was good to hear from you.
Richard B. Hull
President
